thread.title: See Jason Isbell Tease Heavy Rock of New Album
thread.title_full: See Jason Isbell Tease Heavy Rock of New Album

title: See Jason Isbell Tease Heavy Rock of New Album
text:
See Jason Isbell Tease Heavy Rock of New Album Singer-songwriter offers short glimpse into making the follow-up to 'Something More Than Free' Jason Isbell teases a heavy-rock sound for his new album, the follow-up to 'Something More Than Free.' 
Jason Isbell's new album is coming – and it is heavy. Related PHOTOS: 2017 Country Music Preview: Most Anticipated Albums, Tours and Festivals From new albums by Chris Stapleton, Shania Twain and Sam Hunt to massive country gatherings like Stagecoach and CMA Music Festival 
"Stay Tuned. . ." reads the inscription above a 33-second teaser video that appeared on the singer's Facebook. Featuring a montage of in-the-studio footage from Isbell's recent recording session, the clip also includes a half-minute snippet of guitar feedback, orchestral strings and Zeppelin-worthy riffage, presumably lifted from a new song. 
Rounding out the video are appearances by producer Dave Cobb and all five members of the 400 Unit – guitarist Sadler Vaden, fiddle player Amanda Shires, keyboardist Derry DeBorja, bassist Jimbo Hart and drummer Chad Gamble – as well as some gorgeous black-and-white shots of Cobb's new digs in RCA Studio A. The takeaway? Isbell has rounded up his Grammy-winning team, cranked the guitar amps by a few degrees and made another album in Nashville, following the release of 2015's mellow Something More Than Free with something that may well be big and bombastic. 
Still a road warrior, Isbell hits the highway this March, following a trip to Mexico for the Avett Brothers' At the Beach Festival this weekend with a handful of headlining dates that stretch into May. More News
